body:
I am looking into it but it is hard to reproduce.

Is it possible to run this test with sanitizers?
For Bazel - add `--config=asan` to enable address sanitizer
Another thing that would be helpful is enabling `rls_lb` tracing. See [here](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/TROUBLESHOOTING.md) for details.

I tried with enabling rls_lib

with following env variables

```
"GRPC_VERBOSITY" to "DEBUG"
and
"GRPC_TRACE" to "rls_lb"
```
I could repro the crash but there are no relevant logs

I also tried compiling grpc with asan enabled

Built from source with
```
-DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fsanitize=address -fno-omit-frame-pointer -O0" \
    -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fsanitize=address -fno-omit-frame-pointer -O0"
```

but I am facing compiler errors like below with these flags

```

[1744/1757] Running gRPC C++ protocol buffer compiler for src/proto/grpc/channelz/channelz.proto
--

  | cd /home/udocker/velox-debian-11-generic-image/_setup/deps-download/grpc/_build/protos && /usr/local/bin/protoc-30.0.0 --grpc_out=generate_mock_code=true:/home/udocker/velox-debian-11-generic-image/_setup/deps-download/grpc/_build/gens --cpp_out=/home/udocker/velox-debian-11-generic-image/_setup/deps-download/grpc/_build/gens --plugin=protoc-gen-grpc=/home/udocker/velox-debian-11-generic-image/_setup/deps-download/grpc/_build/grpc_cpp_plugin -I . -I /usr/local/include src/proto/grpc/channelz/channelz.proto

(/home/udocker/velox-debian-11-generic-image/_setup/deps-download/grpc/_build/grpc_cpp_plugin+0x555042)
  | AddressSanitizer can not provide additional info.
  | AddressSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL
  | AddressSanitizer: nested bug in the same thread, aborting.
  | --grpc_out: protoc-gen-grpc: Plugin failed with status code 1.
  | [1745/1757] Linking CXX executable grpc_csharp_plugin
  | ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.


```
Looks like protobuf compiler triggers ASAN. @veblush @yashykt - can you advise how to use ASAN with CMAKE?
IIRC, if using ASAN, all libraries and application need to be built with `-fsanitize=address`. Refer https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/19224
Make sure you perform a clean build after the flags are configured.

issue.title: [RLS] fix use-after-free from accessing config after LB policy shutdown

labels.name: release notes: no
labels.description: Indicates if PR should not be in release notes

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

body: Waiting for a response before closing
I don't see any crashes after cherrypicking the fix thanks!
